content:
Preparing for Time Sheets and Resource Absences

Before your agents use time sheets or specify resource absences, set up these features.

REQUIRED EDITIONS
Workforce Engagement is available in Enterprise, Performance, and Unlimited Editions
Shift Scheduling is available in the Contact Center Stock Keeping Unit (SKU), Einstein 1 Service Edition, and Service Suites

EXAMPLE
NOTE Workforce Engagement is scheduled for retirement. See Workforce Engagement Retirement.

CONFIGURATION STEP

1. Assign permission sets.
	* Shift Scheduling Planner or Workforce Engagement Planner to users who approve time sheets and absences
	* Shift Scheduling Agent or Workforce Engagement Agent to users who submit time sheets and absences

2. Create service resources for each agent who submits time sheets and absences.

3. Add related lists:
	+ Absences and Time Sheets to the Service Resources object
	+ Time Sheet Entry related list to the Time Sheets object

4. Allow agents to access their own Service Resource records with an Apex trigger.

5. (Optional) Set up a manual approval process for resource absences, adding the Status field if required.
6. (Optional) Set up a Salesforce approval process for resource absences and time sheets.
title: Preparing Time Sheets and Resource Absences in Service Cloud
